paths./account/change-password.post.desc:
Set a new password for the account.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./account/places.get.description:
List the *Places* of the account.

**Note:** requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./account/places.post.description:
Create a new *Place*.

A *Device* (`class`: `MINT`, `address`: `0`) is automatically created and attached to the new *Place*.

**Note:** requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./account/tokens.get.description:
List the active *Tokens* on the account.

**Note:** requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./account/tokens.get.summary: List active Tokens of the Account
paths./account/tokens/{tokenId}.delete.d:
Revoke the given *Token*.

**Note:** requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./account/users.get.description: Get the list of *Users* of this *Account*.
paths./account/users.post.description:
Add a *User*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./account/users/{userId}.delete.des:
Delete a *User* from this *Account*, and revoke all his/her *Tokens*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./account/users/{userId}.get.descri: Get information about a *User* in the same *Account*.
paths./account/users/{userId}.patch.desc:
Modify a *User*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./account/users/{userId}/metadata.p:
Modify the metadata.
Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.
Successful. The new metadata is returned.
paths./auth/login.post.description:
Get an access+refresh tokens pair from login and password information.

The *access token* obtained with this request can then be used in
an `Access-Token` HTTP header or in a `token` URL query parameter
in requests that require authentication.

The *refresh token* can be used with `/auth/refresh` when the *access
token* expires to retrieve a new *access token*. The lifetime of the
refresh token is the maximum lifetime of this authentication request.

The default lifetime of the *refresh token* is defined by the `appId`
used. The `ttl` input parameter allows to request a *refresh token*
with a shorter lifetime.

To implement *logout*, use `/auth/revoke`.
paths./auth/login.post.responses.200.des: Login successful. The access token is given to use the API. The refresh token must be stored in a safe place.
paths./auth/refresh.post.description:
Get a new *access token* using a valid *refresh token*.

This is a **replacement** of the *access token*: if an existing *access
token* was still not expired, it is invalidated.
paths./auth/refresh.post.responses.200.d: Refresh successful. A new access token is given to use the API.
paths./auth/reset-password.post.descript:
Trigger the request of a new password.

The account administrator will receive an e-mail with an URL pointing to a form
to allow him/her to enter a new password.
The old password is still functional until a new one is submitted.

Either the login or e-mail of the account must be given.
paths./auth/reset-password.post.response: As this request is not authenticated, response is always successful to not reveal (in)existence of accounts.
paths./auth/revoke.post.description:
Invalidate the authentication used for the request. The access token and the refresh token will be invalid after this request.
This request is typically called to implement logout.
paths./auth/revoke.post.responses.204.de: Revocation successful. The token used for the request is now invalid.
paths./devices/{deviceId}.patch.descript: Modify information about a *Device*: its name.
paths./devices/{deviceId}/functionalitie:
Add a *Functionality* to the device.

Required parameters are :
- functionality class
- endpoint

Each device class has its own restrictions on which Functionality classes can be added and on which endpoints.
Only a few devices allow to add Functionalities.

|Device class|Functionality class|Endpoints|
|------------|-------------------|---------|
|MINT        |CurrentPeriod      |1,2,3    |
|MINT        |ElectricityRates   |1,2,3    |
|MINT        |GenericRate        |1,2,3    |

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./devices/{deviceId}/metadata.patch:
Modify the metadata.
Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.
Successful. The new metadata is returned.
paths./devices/{deviceId}/run/{action}.p: Run an *Action* on zero, one or multiple Functionalities selected with tags.
paths./devices/{deviceId}/tags.patch.res: Successful. The new list of tags is returned.
paths./functionalities/{functionalityId}: Modify information about a *Functionality*: its name.

Get the values of multiple *Attributes* and their history.

If the `names` parameter is not given, all the attributes of the *Functionality*
are returned. As the list may be huge, this must be avoided.

If the `to` parameter is set, `from` must also be set.

If `from` is not set, only the last value is returned.

The `surround` parameter allows to ask also for one value beyond each interval boundaries.

The request may fail if too many values are asked.
If true, return also one value before from and one value after to
Get the *Attribute* value and the last time when it changed.
No value has yet been set on this attribute.

Modify the metadata.
Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.
Successful. The new metadata is returned.
Run an action on the Functionality.
Successful. The new list of tags is returned.
paths./me.get.description:
Get information on the authenticated *User* who does the request.

The *login* property is returned only if the *User* is the administrator of
the *Account*.
paths./me.patch.parameters[0].name: userPatch
paths./notifications/{notificationId}/me:
Modify the metadata of a *Notification*.
Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.
Successful. The new metadata is returned.
paths./places.get.description: List the *Places* to which the *Token* has access.
paths./places/{placeId}.patch.descriptio:
Change information about a *Place*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./places/{placeId}/buses.get.descri:
Get the list of *Buses* available on the gateway of this *Place*.
If `withPairing` is `true`, return only buses that allow device pairing (see `/places/{placeId}/buses/{busId}/pairing`).
paths./places/{placeId}/buses.get.parame: Filter out buses that have no pairing window
paths./places/{placeId}/buses/{busId}/pa:
Get the state of the pairing window of the *Bus*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.

Open/Close the pairing window.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./places/{placeId}/devices.get.desc: Get the list of *Devices* available in this *Place*.
paths./places/{placeId}/electricity/auto:
Compute the autonomy rate of the *Place* on a time period.

`autonomy = 1 - (elec_drawn / elec_total_usage)`
Get autonomy rate of the place
paths./places/{placeId}/electricity/flow:
Get the mapping of virtual electricity flows to functionalities.

Some rules are applied to expand the virtual flows using the concrete
flows available.

The `factor` tells how each energy value coming from a functionality
must be added with values from other functionality to compute the
energy of the virtual flow. Factors are usually `1` or `-1`.

The `code` property gives the result which may be partial:
- If all flows are available, `200000` is returned.
- If no flows are available (indicating that the place has no
  electricity functionality or that no functionality has been attached
  to a flow), the `code` is `200001`. The `missing` property contains
  all the requested flows.
- If some flows are missing, the `code` is `200002` and the `missing`
  property lists them.
Place is available. `code` gives the functional result.

Get the mapping of functionalities to electricity flows.

A functionality is attached to *at most* one flow.
paths./places/{placeId}/electricity/self:
Compute the self-consumption rate of the *Place* on a time period.

`selfConsumption = 1 - (elec_feed_in / elec_total_usage)`
Get self-consumption rate of the place
Get the list of *Functionalities* available in this *Place*.
paths./places/{placeId}/metadata.patch.d:
Modify the metadata.
Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.
paths./places/{placeId}/metadata.patch.r: Successful. The new metadata is returned.
paths./places/{placeId}/notifications.ge: Get the list of *Notifications* available in this *Place*.
paths./places/{placeId}/programs.get.des: Get the list of *Programs* available in this *Place*.
paths./places/{placeId}/programs.post.de:
Create a new *Program*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./places/{placeId}/run/{action}.pos:
Run an *Action* on zero, one or multiple *Functionalities* selected with tags.

*Device* and *Functionality* selection are combined with Â« AND Â».

If no functionality is matched by the device/functionality selection, an empty array is returned.
paths./programs/{programId}.delete.descr:
Delete a *Program*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./programs/{programId}.patch.descri:
Modify a *Program*:
- name
- status (enabled/disabled)
- code

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.
paths./programs/{programId}/log.get.desc: Get the execution history list of this *Program*.
paths./programs/{programId}/log.get.summ: History of executions of a Program
paths./programs/{programId}/metadata.pat:
Modify the metadata of a *Program*.
Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.
Successful. The new metadata is returned.
paths./programs/{programId}/run.post.des:
Launch the *Program*.
The result will be available later in the run history.
responses.ErrorAccessAccount.description: The authentication token doesn't allow to modify the *Account*.
responses.ErrorAccessBus.description: *Bus* doesn't exist or the requester doesn't have appropriate access to the *Place*.
responses.ErrorAccessDevice.description: *Device* doesn't exist or the requester doesn't have appropriate access to the *Place*.
responses.ErrorAccessFunctionality.descr: *Functionality* doesn't exist or the requester doesn't have appropriate access to the *Place*.
responses.ErrorAccessNotification.descri: *Notification* doesn't exist or the requester doesn't have appropriate access to the *Place*.
responses.ErrorAccessPlace.description: *Place* doesn't exist or the requester doesn't have access.
responses.ErrorAccessProgram.description: *Program* doesn't exist or the requester doesn't have appropriate access to the *Place*.
responses.ErrorAccessUser.description: *User* doesn't exist in this *Account* or the requester doesn't have access to a *Place* on which this *User* has access.
responses.ErrorGatewayUnreachable.descri: The gateway of the Place is not reachable.
